articles.description: Europe open a healthy 6½-1½ lead over the United States after a sensational opening day of the Ryder Cup.
articles.title: Europe open big lead over US in Ryder Cup

articles.description: Aaron Smith scores a 33-minute hat-trick as New Zealand thrash Italy in Pool A to move to the cusp of the World Cup quarter-finals.
articles.title: All Blacks thrash Italy to boost knockout hopes

articles.description: An historic undisputed heavyweight fight between champions Tyson Fury and Oleksandr Usyk has been "signed", according to Queensbury Promotions.
articles.title: Fury to face Usyk in undisputed title fight in Saudi

articles.description: Watch some of the best shots from day one of the Ryder Cup, featuring Tyrrell Hatton, Max Homa, Rory McIlroy, Rickie Fowler and three from Jon Rahm.
articles.title: Rahm stars as Europe take big lead - shots of the day

articles.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag says Premier League players cannot cope with the demands placed on them as injuries mount up.
articles.title: 'Players can't deal any more with this overload'

articles.description: Illness "spreading" through the United States Ryder Cup team has contributed to their 6½-1½ deficit to Europe after the opening day in Rome, says captain Zach Johnson.
articles.title: Illness affecting US Ryder Cup camp - Johnson

articles.description: Players are "scared" and "worried" at the raft of anterior cruciate knee ligament injuries in women's football, says Birmingham City's Siobhan Wilson.
articles.title: Female footballers 'scared' about rise in ACL injuries

articles.description: Manchester United's Brazilian winger Antony is to return to training after allegations of domestic abuse were made against him.
articles.title: Man Utd confirm Antony will return to training

articles.description: Hull KR exact revenge for their Challenge Cup final loss to Leigh Leopards with Super League play-off eliminator victory.
articles.title: Hull KR avenge Leigh Wembley loss to reach semis

articles.description: Sunderland move up to fourth in the Championship as they dismantle winless Sheffield Wednesday at Hillsborough.
articles.title: Clarke scores twice in Sunderland win at Sheff Wed
